article.title: NCI to Support PEO Soldier
article.text: NCI Inc., Reston, Virginia, recently announced it was awarded a five-year, cost-plus-fixed-fee contract valued at $211 million to provide agile acquisition, systems engineering and logistics services for the U.S. Army Program Executive Office (PEO) Soldier headquarters and subordinate PEO programs at Fort Belvoir, Virginia. NCI will continue to support PEO Soldier headquarters and its subordinate project management offices in their mission to rapidly outfit U.S. soldiers with the best products available. Expanded efforts also will include engineering, quality assurance, test, acquisition, business management, logistics and fielding, operations and administrative support. All phases of system lifecycle management are covered under the contract, including technology, engineering and manufacturing development; production and deployment; and operations and support for PEO Soldier assets in response to military requirements worldwide. The contract consists of a 12-month base period with four one-year option periods.
